channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta's stock drop tells the wrong story on earnings — so, we're boosting our price target
item.description: Don't let the after-hours stock action fool you, Meta delivered one heck of a strong quarter and rosy revenue guidance.

item.title: Samsung Electronics' chip profit shrinks 40% from the previous quarter
item.description: The semiconductor unit reported third-quarter operating profit of 3.86 trillion won (about $2.8 billion), down 40% from the previous quarter.

item.title: A Financier Penned a Crime Novel. Prosecutors Want to Know How Much Was Fiction.
item.description: Jay Newman, who steered Elliott Management to a $2 billion payday over Argentine debt, also had contact with an alleged hacking mastermind.

item.title: Coinbase shares fall as muted crypto trading leads to a third-quarter miss
item.description: Coinbase Wednesday reported weaker-than-expected third-quarter results, weighed down by muted trading in the cryptocurrency market.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.1% to 98.98
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index dropped 0.1%, snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.

item.title: We reiterate our 1 rating on Microsoft despite its softer guidance — here's why
item.description: The numbers look different this quarter due the company re-segmenting a few businesses, but overall there's not much to complain about.

item.title: New Starbucks CEO shares more details on his turnaround plan. We like what we heard
item.description: Starbucks stock edged higher in extended trading Wednesday night.

item.title: Gold Steady; Remains Supported by Haven Demand
item.description: Gold was steady in early Asian trade, after topping $2,800/oz for the first time on Wednesday.

item.title: Nikkei Down 0.1%, Dragged by Electronics Stocks
item.description: Japanese stocks were lower, dragged by falls in electronics stocks, amid caution before the Bank of Japan’s policy meeting outcome.

item.title: Oil Rises Amid Middle East Tensions
item.description: Oil rose in early Asian trade. Prices were significantly affected by recent geopolitical tensions in Israel and Lebanon, says Rania Gule, analyst at X...
